src package

Submodules

src.cli module

src.cli.cli(arg_dict)[source]

The function updates the settings based on command-line flags. If the provided flag is boolean, the existing boolean value is just flipped. Otherwise, the default settings are updated from the command-line flag values.

src.cols module

class src.cols.Cols(names)[source]

Bases: object

The Cols class iterates over a list of column names and determines whether the Column name is that of a Numeric column opr that of a Symbols column. Based on the name of the column the Cols class also determines whether the Column is dependent or independent. Lastly it also determines whether the column is a simgle dependent klass column.

Parameters

  • names (list) – List of all column names

  • all (list) – List of all the column objects

  • klass (Sym or Num object) – Sym or Num object

  • x (list) – List of independent columns

  • y – List of depenedent columns

Type

y: list

src.row module

class src.row.Row(row: list)[source]

Bases: object

The Row class recieves a csv row which is one record of the csv.

Parameters

cells – contains one record of the csv

: type cells: list

Parameters

  • cooked (list) – duplicate of the csv record

  • isEvaled (boolean) – used to determine if y-values are evaluated

src.utils.default_args(def_str, arg_dict)[source]

Retrieves the command-line flags and their corresponding values from def_str and stores them in arg_dict.

Parameters

  • def_str (string) – the command-line flag strings from which settings vaslues are retrieved.

  • arg_dict – the retrieved command-line settings are stored here.

src.utils.o(t)[source]

Returns a string generated from a nested dict and sorts them alphabetically.

param t: a dict or a nested dict.

Returns

a formatted string generated from the nested dict
